CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many slices are there in this pie chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this pie chart.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the clockwise direction from slice Charter Schools?
SRP.A: The next slice clockwise from slice Charter Schools is {Vocational Schools}.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the counterclockwise direction from slice Charter Schools?
SRP.A: The next slice counterclockwise from slice Charter Schools is {International Schools}.

VPR.Q: Which student has the largest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The student with the largest proportion is {Universities}.

VPR.Q: Which student has the smallest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The student with the smallest proportion is {Private Schools}.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Universities slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Universities slice is {25}%.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Vocational Schools slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Vocational Schools slice is {22}%.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Public Schools slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Public Schools slice is {14}%.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in this pie chart?
What is the minimum value in this pie chart?

SC.Q: What is the difference between the values of Public Schools and Vocational Schools in this pie chart?
SC.A: The difference between Public Schools and Vocational Schools is {8}%.

SC.Q: What is the sum of the values of Private Schools and Universities in this pie chart?
SC.A: The sum of Private Schools and Universities is {35}%.

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart exceed 20.5%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.
NF.A: {Universities} accounts for {25}% and {Vocational Schools} accounts for {22}%

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart are below 13.25%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.
NF.A: {Charter Schools} accounts for {13}% and {Private Schools} accounts for {10}%

NC.Q: Which has the largest value: Universities, Vocational Schools, International Schools, or Charter Schools?
NC.A: The value of {Universities} is the largest.

NC.Q: Which is larger, the value of Universities, Vocational Schools, or International Schools?
Which is smaller, the value of Vocational Schools, International Schools, or Public Schools?
NC.A: The value of {Public Schools} is smaller.

MSR.Q: How many sectors have a percentage between 10% and 15%?
MSR.A: There are {3} sectors that have a percentage between 10% and 15%.

MSR.Q: Which three sectors have a sum of percentage less than 45%? List all possible combinations.
MSR.A: The possible combinations are: {(International Schools, Public Schools, Charter Schools), (International Schools, Public Schools, Private Schools), (International Schools, Charter Schools, Private Schools), (Public Schools, Charter Schools, Private Schools)}.
